com.google.iot.cbor

Class CborArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.iot.cbor.CborObject
      • com.google.iot.cbor.CborArray
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<CborObject>

    public abstract class CborArray
extends CborObject
implements Iterable<CborObject>
    Class for representing CBOR array data items.

    This class is used to represent data items of major type 4 (CborMajorType.ARRAY).

      • createFromJavaObject

        public static CborArray createFromJavaObject(Iterable<?> obj)
                                      throws CborConversionException
        Converts an Iterable of Java objects to an untagged CborArray. Note that this method differs from create(Iterable) in that this method converts standard Java objects (like String, Integer, etc) into CborObjects.
        Parameters:
        obj - the iterable of java objects to convert
        Returns:
        new CborArray instance
        Throws:
        CborConversionException - if one or more of the contained objects cannot be converted

      • getAdditionalInformation

        public final int getAdditionalInformation()
        Description copied from class: CborObject

      • isValidJson

        public boolean isValidJson()
        Description copied from class: CborObject
        Indicates if this data item can be losslessly converted to a JSON fragment.

        Note that, with few exceptions, tags are not considered in this determination, since CborObject.toJsonString() will strip out tags anyway.

        Specified by:
        isValidJson in class CborObject
        Returns:
        true if this object could be rendered as JSON, false otherwise.

      • toJsonString

        public final String toJsonString()
        Description copied from class: CborObject
        Returns a representation of this data item as JSON text.

        The result is guaranteed to be syntactically-valid RFC8259 JSON text. In the event that there is no JSON text representation for the underlying data item, its value will be replaced with a placeholder JSON value (usually "null"). This condition can be detected beforehand using CborObject.isValidJson().

        Note that, in some pre-RFC8259 contexts, this method could be described as returning a "JSON fragment" unless the data item was of the types CborMap (for a JSON object) or CborArray (for a JSON array).

        Specified by:
        toJsonString in class CborObject
        Returns:
        a String containing representation of this data item as JSON text
        See Also:
        CborObject.isValidJson(), RFC8259

      • toJavaObject

        public List<Object> toJavaObject()
        Description copied from class: CborObject
        Converts the given data item into a standard java object representation.

        Tags are largely ignored, except in cases where the tag itself has defined behavior when converting to JSON, like CborTag.EXPECTED_BASE16 and CborTag.EXPECTED_BASE64.

        The resulting object type is dependent on the data item:

        • CborMap Map<Object,Object>
        • CborArray Collection<Object>
        • CborFloat Float/Double
        • CborInteger Integer/Long
        • CborTextString String
        • CborByteString byte[]
        • CborSimple.TRUE/CborSimple.FALSE Boolean
        • Other CborSimple values null
        The returned value is a wholly independent copy.
        Specified by:
        toJavaObject in class CborObject
        See Also:
        CborObject.createFromJavaObject(Object)

      • toJavaObject

        public <T> T toJavaObject(Class<T> clazz)
                   throws CborConversionException
        Description copied from class: CborObject
        Attempts to convert this data item to a java object with a specific class.

        Unlike CborObject.toJavaObject(), this method will introspect into tags to figure out conversions to BigInteger and URI. Unknown tags are ignored.

        This method will return the most expressive result that satisfies the clazz parameter. For example, if the data item is a CborByteString tagged CborTag.BIGNUM_POS, calling this method with different classes will lead to different results:

        • toJavaObject(byte[].class would return a byte[]
        • toJavaObject(Object.class would return a BigInteger
        • toJavaObject(BigInteger.class would return a BigInteger
        • toJavaObject(URI.class would throw CborConversionException
        Whereas this method called an untagged CborByteString would behave like this:
        • toJavaObject(byte[].class would return a byte[]
        • toJavaObject(Object.class would return a byte[]
        • toJavaObject(BigInteger.class would throw CborConversionException
        • toJavaObject(URI.class would throw CborConversionException
        Specified by:
        toJavaObject in class CborObject
        Parameters:
        clazz - The desired class of the returned object
        Returns:
        a reference to an object of class clazz or null if this data item was CborSimple.NULL or CborSimple.UNDEFINED.
        Throws:
        CborConversionException - if the underlying data item could not be represented as an instance of clazz.

      • toString

        public final String toString(int indentLevel)
        Description copied from class: CborObject
        Describes this data item using CBOR diagnostic notation at the given indentation level.

        The output is similar to that of CborObject.toJsonString() except that it also includes tag and encoding information that is CBOR-specific.

        The returned string is intended as a diagnostic aid and not intended to be machine-readable.

        Specified by:
        toString in class CborObject
        Parameters:
        indentLevel - the indentation level of the string to output. A negative value indicates no newlines or whitespace should be added.
        Returns:
        a String describing the data item.
        See Also:
        CBOR Diagnostic Notation, CborObject.toString()
